column2: ARKANSAS DMV PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. _________________ your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes.
column8: Never depend on

column2: 2. When driving on the freeway behind large trucks, you should:
column6: move to the right of the truck and pass it quickly.
column8: drive closer behind the truck than for a passenger vehicle.

column2: 3. If you see orange construction signs and cones on a freeway, you must:
column4: be prepared for workers and equipment ahead.
column6: make a U-turn because the lane ends ahead.
column8: maintain your current speed while changing lanes.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column8: Winding road

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column8: Road curves ahead

column2: 6. Excessive speed:
column4: helps you to maneuver around obstacles.
column6: saves time so you can get to your destination more quickly.
column8: increases the likelihood of serious bodily injuries and death.

column2: 7. Braking distance is how far a vehicle travels:
column6: before the driver hits the brakes.
column8: while the driver is braking.

column2: 8. To avoid hydroplaning, drivers should:
column8: slow down.

column2: 9. The basic color for traffic control devices used in construction zones is:
column8: yellow.

column2: 10. Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
column8: Railroad advance warning signs (round)

column2: 11. If another vehicle passes you on the left, you must:
column4: increase your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column6: decrease your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column8: decrease your speed, then pull over to the right and stop.

column2: 12. When in a vehicle, wear a seat belt:
column8: on long trips.

column2: 13. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column6: move your eyes to the right.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 14. A flashing red light means:
column6: The light will soon change to steady red.
column8: The same as a STOP sign.

column2: 15. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
column8: red lights.

column2: 16. When preparing to exit an expressway, drivers should start reducing their speed:
column4: at least 100 feet before entering the deceleration lane.
column6: about halfway through the deceleration lane.
column8: immediately upon entering the deceleration lane.

column2: 17. When driving in work zones, drivers should:
column4: maintain their speed through the work zone.
column6: reduce their speed and be prepared to stop.
column8: closely follow the driver in front of them.

column2: 18. When driving on gravel roads:
column4: you should keep your eyes moving.
column6: you should use cruise control to increase traction.
column8: your tires do not have as much traction.

column2: 19. Just like alcohol and other drugs, drowsiness can:
column4: help you to be a better driver.
column8: impair your judgment.

column2: 20. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: be ready to shift to lower gear.
column6: be ready to brake sharply and stop.
column8: yield to trucks coming from the hill on the right.

column2: 21. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column4: Get out of the car and check behind the car.
column8: Look through your back window for children.

column2: 22. When changing lanes, you should remember that:
column4: vehicles with two outside mirrors have no blind spots.
column6: You only need to turn and look over your right shoulder for lane changes to the right or left.
column8: you should look over your left shoulder for a left lane change and your right shoulder for a right lane change.

column2: 23. Give the right-of-way to any pedestrian:
column4: if you have the green light.
column8: on the opposite side of the street.

column2: 24. Directions given by traffic officers ___________ signs, signals or pavement markings.
column8: must obey

column2: 25. This sign means:
column4: Curve ahead, drive at 40 MPH ot more around the curve ahead
column6: Curve ahead, the recommended speed is 40 MPH or less
column8: If you are driving at 40 MPH or less you must stay in the right-hand lane
